channel.title: Write a quest for RSCEmulation
channel.description:
If you're fluent in Java and want to contribute, feel free to write a P2P quest for RSCEmulation. I'll more than happily assist you along the way.
I'm not asking for opinions on the system itself. I'm sure there's better ways of doing things, but all our quests are written like this and they work. There's been over 10,000 completed quests on RSCEmulation so far.
Sample quest (Romeo & Juliet):
[b]Juliet.java:[/b] http://pastebin.com/gH9MP0TL
[b]Romeo.java:[/b] http://pastebin.com/LqN5JJqu
[b]Apothecary.java:[/b] http://pastebin.com/AWLfVTAu
[b]Father_Lawrence.java:[/b] http://pastebin.com/re6ahKmq

item.title: Write a quest for RSCEmulation
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“latifundio, post:9, topic:415638”][quote author=veer link=topic=517555.msg3760448#msg3760448 date=1316822504]
Is this really how “the most popular RSC server” implements quests? That is quite /frankly/ some of the ugliest code I’ve seen. Does anyone do it differently in a more clean fashion?
[/quote]Well at least it works. Here are some of the quest available atm (might be others on old forums posts)
http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/darkquest/DarkQuest/src/org/darkquest/gs/plugins/quests/

And these two incomplete
Black Knight Fortress
Vampire Slayer[/quote]RSCE has all the F2P quests implemented.

Read full topic

item.title: Write a quest for RSCEmulation
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

RSCE is better in other ways(Seen the src), but quests are made very ugly way, but as long as it works and doesn’t have any performance decreases it’s fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Write a quest for RSCEmulation
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:6, topic:415638”][quote author=waj link=topic=517555.msg3760405#msg3760405 date=1316819522]

I thought your source was complety different than rscd? Looks the same to me strange.

It’s identical, haven’t changed a thing.

pretty sure you have claimed your source is 100% better than rscd more than 2 times, and that yours has the most work on it ectect, when basically all I ever see if client side stuff and webite?
[/quote]Yeah all you see is this website and client…[/quote]
Im obviously talking about the most recent updates he has done…

Read full topic

item.title: Write a quest for RSCEmulation
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

If you’re fluent in Java and want to contribute, feel free to write a P2P quest for RSCEmulation. I’ll more than happily assist you along the way.

I’m not asking for opinions on the system itself. I’m sure there’s better ways of doing things, but all our quests are written like this and they work. There’s been over 10,000 completed quests on RSCEmulation so far.

Sample quest (Romeo & Juliet):

Juliet.java:
http://pastebin.com/gH9MP0TL

Romeo.java:
http://pastebin.com/LqN5JJqu

Apothecary.java:
http://pastebin.com/AWLfVTAu

Father_Lawrence.java:
http://pastebin.com/re6ahKmq
